Deleting > 26000 files via CLI

24 Mar 2015 on bash

I came across a problem today, were I wanted to delete about 49000 files in a folder with a specific file name. First thing I tried was rm -f *foo.xml but permanently got the error
-bash: /bin/rm: Argument list too long. In short, the problem is that the command exceeds getconf ARG_MAX, which is set to 262144 on my machine (depends on your linux kernel).
So how to workaround this problem? Just use a simple for loop in bash:
for f in *foo.xml; do rm "$f"; done
Optionally you could create a bash function that accepts a filename as an argument. Further Information can be found here.

Kai Sören Becker

My name is Kai Sören Becker and I’m a web-developer and android enthusiast from Wiesbaden.
